result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pernell D Evans

records.addlTxt:
2:52 PM Defendant Pernell D Evans in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Pernell D Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Dismissed and Read-in to: 21CM2000 and 22CF1609.

Cash bond posted to be refunded to poster.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

CASH BOND AMENDED TO $200.00.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

2:22 PM Defendant Pernell D Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Pernell D Evans. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for plea/sentencing hearing. 
Defense advises that counsel that was covering previous hearing set for plea/sentencing, but bail motion should have been set re: bail motion filed on 10/18/2022 on 22CF1557.

State is ready to proceed on Bail Motion. 
Defense makes arguments in support of Motion for Bail Modification on 22CF1557 and 22CF1609, specifically requesting lower cash bail and/or a signature bond. 
State makes arguments in opposition to any modification to bond. 
Defendant's girlfriend makes statements. 

For reasons stated on the record, the Court will grant the motion to modify bond. 
Bond on 22CF1557: Cash bond lowered to $200.00.
Bond on 22CF1609: Cash bond lowered to $1000.00

Defense requests a short plea/sentencing hearing. Courts sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court notes the defendant currently has a date before the Trial Court on October 24, 2022 at 2:15 pm and will adjourn this matter to that date and time as defendant is currently represented by Attorney Jeffrey Jensen Jr.
